Breadth-First.Explanation: General clue collection and broad observations about station, signage, architecture, landscape
Generating multiple railway hypotheses (rack railway, Werdenfelsbahn) and shallow comparison
Exploring various station options (Mittenwald, Untergrainau) by collecting further visual clues
Introducing a new station hypothesis (Farchant) after initial verification remained inconclusive
Considering another alternative location (Garmisch-Hausberg) with observed platform and building features

Depth-First.Explanation: Verifying specific hypothesis about Grainau’s church spire being an onion dome
Depth-First.KeyElement: Onion-dome shape of St. Anton parish church

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirming that the spire is pointed, not onion-shaped, and shifting to a Protestant church hypothesis
Depth-First.KeyElement: Pointed slender tower of Evangelical Church of the Redeemer

Depth-First.Explanation: Examining track alignment and station building details along Zugspitzstraße to narrow location
Depth-First.KeyElement: Slender church tower and arched-window maintenance building

Depth-First.Explanation: Analyzing railway safety signs to confirm Bavarian Zugspitzbahn operation and listing known stops
Depth-First.KeyElement: “Zugverkehr beachten!” sign and no-entry silhouette sign

Depth-First.Explanation: Synthesizing multiple detailed clues (signage, infrastructure, landscape, architecture, district) to confirm Grainau station in Untergrainau
Depth-First.KeyElement: Combination of warning sign, metre-gauge catenary, chalet architecture, Evangelische Erlöserkirche steeple

Depth-First.Explanation: Final location confirmation summarizing all verified evidence

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shifted from broad exploration of multiple stations to targeted verification of church spire hypothesis
After station-type clues remained inconclusive, diverged to consider an alternative (Farchant) hypothesis
Returned to convergent analysis to synthesize detailed evidence and confirm final station
